line_1: TO thee, sweet Fop, these Lines I send,
line_2: Who, tho' no Spaniel, am a Friend.

line_1: Who, tho' no Spaniel, am a Friend.
line_2: TO thee, sweet Fop, these Lines I send,

line_1: Tho, once my Tail in wanton play,
line_2: Now frisking this, and then that way,

line_1: Now frisking this, and then that way,
line_2: Tho, once my Tail in wanton play,

line_1: Chanc'd, with a Touch of just the Tip,
line_2: To hurt your Lady-lap-dog-ship;

line_1: To hurt your Lady-lap-dog-ship;
line_2: Chanc'd, with a Touch of just the Tip,

line_1: Yet thence to think I'd bite your Head off!
line_2: Sure Bounce is one you never read of.

line_1: Sure Bounce is one you never read of.
line_2: Yet thence to think I'd bite your Head off!

line_1: FOP! you can dance, and make a Leg,
line_2: Can fetch and carry, cringe and beg,

line_1: Can fetch and carry, cringe and beg,
line_2: FOP! you can dance, and make a Leg,

line_1: And (what's the Top of all your Tricks)
line_2: Can stoop to pick up Strings and Sticks.

line_1: Can stoop to pick up Strings and Sticks.
line_2: And (what's the Top of all your Tricks)

line_1: We Country Dogs love nobler Sport,
line_2: And scorn the Pranks of Dogs at Court.

line_1: And scorn the Pranks of Dogs at Court.
line_2: We Country Dogs love nobler Sport,

line_1: Fye, naughty Fop! where e'er you come
line_2: To f—t and p—ss about the Room,

line_1: To f—t and p—ss about the Room,
line_2: Fye, naughty Fop! where e'er you come

line_1: To lay your Head in every Lap,
line_2: And, when they think not of you — snap!

line_1: And, when they think not of you — snap!
line_2: To lay your Head in every Lap,

line_1: The worst that Envy, or that Spite
line_2: E'er said of me, is, I can bite:

line_1: E'er said of me, is, I can bite:
line_2: The worst that Envy, or that Spite

line_1: That sturdy Vagrants, Rogues in Rags,
line_2: Who poke at me, can make no Brags;

line_1: Who poke at me, can make no Brags;
line_2: That sturdy Vagrants, Rogues in Rags,

line_1: And that to towze such Things as flutter,
line_2: To honest Bounce is Bread and Butter.

line_1: To honest Bounce is Bread and Butter.
line_2: And that to towze such Things as flutter,

line_1: While you, and every courtly Fop,
line_2: Fawn on the Devil for a Chop,

line_1: Fawn on the Devil for a Chop,
line_2: While you, and every courtly Fop,

line_1: I've the Humanity to hate
line_2: A Butcher, tho' he brings me Meat;

line_1: A Butcher, tho' he brings me Meat;
line_2: I've the Humanity to hate

line_1: And let me tell you, have a Nose,
line_2: (Whatever stinking Fops suppose)

line_1: (Whatever stinking Fops suppose)
line_2: And let me tell you, have a Nose,

line_1: That under Cloth of Gold or Tissue,
line_2: Can smell a Plaister, or an Issue.

line_1: Can smell a Plaister, or an Issue.
line_2: That under Cloth of Gold or Tissue,

line_1: Your pilf'ring Lord, with simple Pride,
line_2: May wear a Pick-lock at his Side;

line_1: May wear a Pick-lock at his Side;
line_2: Your pilf'ring Lord, with simple Pride,

line_1: My Master wants no Key of State,
line_2: For Bounce can keep his House and Gate.

line_1: For Bounce can keep his House and Gate.
line_2: My Master wants no Key of State,

line_1: When all such Dogs have had their Days,
line_2: As knavish Pams, and fawning Trays;

line_1: As knavish Pams, and fawning Trays;
line_2: When all such Dogs have had their Days,

line_1: When pamper'd Cupids, beastly Veni's,
line_2: And motly, squinting Harvequini's,

line_1: And motly, squinting Harvequini's,
line_2: When pamper'd Cupids, beastly Veni's,

line_1: Shall lick no more their Lady's Br—,
line_2: But die of Looseness, Claps, or Itch;

line_1: But die of Looseness, Claps, or Itch;
line_2: Shall lick no more their Lady's Br—,

line_1: Fair Thames from either ecchoing Shore
line_2: Shall hear, and dread my manly Roar.

line_1: Shall hear, and dread my manly Roar.
line_2: Fair Thames from either ecchoing Shore

line_1: See Bounce, like Berecynthia, crown'd
line_2: With thund'ring Offspring all around,

line_1: With thund'ring Offspring all around,
line_2: See Bounce, like Berecynthia, crown'd

line_1: Beneath, beside me, and a top,
line_2: A hundred Sons! and not one Fop.

line_1: A hundred Sons! and not one Fop.
line_2: Beneath, beside me, and a top,

line_1: Before my Children set your Beef,
line_2: Not one true Bounce will be a Thief;

line_1: Not one true Bounce will be a Thief;
line_2: Before my Children set your Beef,

line_1: Not one without Permission feed,
line_2: (Tho' some of J—'s hungry Breed)

line_1: (Tho' some of J—'s hungry Breed)
line_2: Not one without Permission feed,

line_1: But whatsoe'er the Father's Race,
line_2: From me they suck a little Grace.

line_1: From me they suck a little Grace.
line_2: But whatsoe'er the Father's Race,

line_1: While your fine Whelps learn all to steal,
line_2: Bred up by Hand on Chick and Veal.

line_1: Bred up by Hand on Chick and Veal.
line_2: While your fine Whelps learn all to steal,

line_1: My Eldest-born resides not far,
line_2: Where shines great Strafford's glittering Star:

line_1: Where shines great Strafford's glittering Star:
line_2: My Eldest-born resides not far,

line_1: My second (Child of Fortune!) waits
line_2: At Burlington's Palladian Gates:

line_1: At Burlington's Palladian Gates:
line_2: My second (Child of Fortune!) waits

line_1: A third majestically stalks
line_2: (Happiest of Dogs!) in Cobham's Walks:

line_1: (Happiest of Dogs!) in Cobham's Walks:
line_2: A third majestically stalks

line_1: One ushers Friends to Bathurst's Door;
line_2: One fawns, at Oxford's, on the Poor.

line_1: One fawns, at Oxford's, on the Poor.
line_2: One ushers Friends to Bathurst's Door;

line_1: Nobles, whom Arms or Arts adorn,
line_2: Wait for my Infants yet unborn.

line_1: Wait for my Infants yet unborn.
line_2: Nobles, whom Arms or Arts adorn,

line_1: None but a Peer of Wit and Grace,
line_2: Can hope a Puppy of my Race.

line_1: Can hope a Puppy of my Race.
line_2: None but a Peer of Wit and Grace,

line_1: And O! wou'd Fate the Bliss decree
line_2: To mine (a Bliss too great for me)

line_1: To mine (a Bliss too great for me)
line_2: And O! wou'd Fate the Bliss decree

line_1: That two, my tallest Sons, might grace
line_2: Attending each with stately Pace,

line_1: Attending each with stately Pace,
line_2: That two, my tallest Sons, might grace

line_1: Iulus' Side, as erst Evander's,
line_2: To keep off Flatt'rers, Spies, and Panders,

line_1: To keep off Flatt'rers, Spies, and Panders,
line_2: Iulus' Side, as erst Evander's,

line_1: To let no noble Slave come near,
line_2: And scare Lord Fannys from his Ear:

line_1: And scare Lord Fannys from his Ear:
line_2: To let no noble Slave come near,

line_1: Then might a Royal Youth, and true,
line_2: Enjoy at least a Friend — or two:

line_1: Enjoy at least a Friend — or two:
line_2: Then might a Royal Youth, and true,

line_1: A Treasure, which, of Royal kind,
line_2: Few but Himself deserve to find.

line_1: Few but Himself deserve to find.
line_2: A Treasure, which, of Royal kind,

line_1: Then Bounce ('tis all that Bounce can crave)
line_2: Shall wag her Tail within the Grave.

line_1: Shall wag her Tail within the Grave.
line_2: Then Bounce ('tis all that Bounce can crave)

line_1: And tho' no Doctors, Whig or Tory ones,
line_2: Except the Sect of Pythagoreans,

line_1: Except the Sect of Pythagoreans,
line_2: And tho' no Doctors, Whig or Tory ones,

line_1: Have Immortality assign'd
line_2: To any Beast, but Dryden's Hind:

line_1: To any Beast, but Dryden's Hind:
line_2: Have Immortality assign'd

line_1: Yet Master Pope, whom Truth and Sense
line_2: Shall call their Friend some Ages hence,

line_1: Shall call their Friend some Ages hence,
line_2: Yet Master Pope, whom Truth and Sense

line_1: Tho' now on loftier Themes he sings
line_2: Than to bestow a Word on Kings,

line_1: Than to bestow a Word on Kings,
line_2: Tho' now on loftier Themes he sings

line_1: Has sworn by Sticks (the Poet's Oath,
line_2: And Dread of Dogs and Poets both)

line_1: And Dread of Dogs and Poets both)
line_2: Has sworn by Sticks (the Poet's Oath,

line_1: Man and his Works he'll soon renounce,
line_2: And roar in Numbers worthy Bounce.
